doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 38 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 9/23/1987]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 38 [2]--The Right Stuff[Air Date: 9/23/1987]
1. Gay Week in Review, with Andy Humm, Jim Levin, David Strah, and Eleanor Cooper, sponsored by the Human Rights Campaign Fund
2.Discussion about legislature for censoring homophobic remarks by representatives
3.Discussion about Pope John Paul IICOMMERCIAL: San Francisco AIDS Foundation
4.Discussion about Supreme Court nomination of Robert Bork
COMMERCIAL: Human Rights Campaign Fund5.Criticism of Regan's AIDS Panel
6.Washington Countdown, Discussion about events and promotion surrounding the October 11, March on Washington
7.Interview with congressman Tedd Weiss and Bill Green about the Lesbian and Gay rights bill concerning public employment
8.Discussion about ads for the October 11, March on Washington
COMMERCIAL: The Islanders Club9.News Watch, AIDS Fraud and phony treatments
10.Group study about the coping mechanisms of men who took a HIV Antibody Test
11.Censoring of homophic remarks by political representatives
COMMERCIAL:DIA Art Foundation-Art Against AIDS Lavender Health, interview with Tony Davis of VILAGE (Visually Impared in a Lesbian and Gay Enviornment)
1.Show Bitz, Interview with Phillip Officer, including footage of his show
2.Naming Names, criticism of Regan's AIDS Panel member, Penny Pullen, for homophobic remarks
4.Inside Out, Episode, "Clara Dawson" Program talking about the Swiss' response to the AIDS crisis
